summary.para: Flags used by . These values are factors in the decision of whether to display a pop-up window.

The page is unloading. This flag is set in response to the onbeforeunload and onunload events. Some pages load pop-up windows when you leave them, not when you enter. This flag is used to identify those situations.

The call to is the result of a user-initiated action (a mouse click or key press). Use this flag in conjunction with the flag to determine whether the call is a direct or indirect result of the user-initiated action.
When is present, this flag indicates that the call to is the first query that results from this user-initiated action. Always use this flag in conjunction with .
The override key (ALT) was pressed. The override key is used to bypass the pop-up manager—allowing all pop-up windows to display—and must be held down at the time that is called.
Note When is implemented for a WebBrowser control host, the implementer can choose to ignore the override key.
The new window attempting to load is the result of a call to the showHelp method. Help is sometimes displayed in a separate window, and this flag is valuable in those cases.
The new window is a dialog box that displays HTML content.
The method is being called from an HTML dialog. The new window should not show the UI in the parent window.
The new windows was definitely requested by the user, either by selecting Open in New Window from a context menu or pressing Shift and clicking a link.
The call to the method is the result of the user requesting a replay that resulted in a refresh.
The new window should be forced to open in a new window rather than a tab.
The new window should be forced to open in a new tab.
The new window should open in a new tab unless is also present, indicating that user wants the window to open as a window.
The new window should open in a new tab unless is also present, indicating that user wants the window to open as a window.
The method is being called from an inactive tab.
